main event: On July 23, 1952, multiple guards at Norfolk Prison Colony observed a slow-moving, greenish, round and flat object at a low altitude, followed by a loud rushing noise, which disappeared behind a building at the prison.
interesting points: The object was described as a round tilted object, 3 to 5 feet in diameter, black in color, with no aerodynamic features, trail, propulsion system, or sound noted.
The object generated a loud rushing noise as it drifted slowly and disappeared behind a building at the prison.
Witnesses observed the object for approximately two to five seconds visually with no aids, and there was no interception or identification action taken.
The object appeared to be round, flat, and pancake-shaped, and it seemed slow-moving, flying from north to south at a very low altitude over the prison.
Multiple officers were talking when they noticed the object, and they reported the sighting on the same day.
sighted object: slow-moving, greenish, round and flat object at a low altitude
witnesses: Multiple guards at Norfolk Prison Colony
photographs: no photographs available in the report
